ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned how to be techniques painting in oil on canvas, and with painting in general. Specifically, I feel like I gained a lot of confidence in my creative process and in my art. I think this class not only teaches one how to paint but also teaches one how to approach a project, use feedback from past projects and build upon each work you make. I also developed critique skills.
I learned how to use oil paint and work with canvas.
Learned a lot about painting techniques, color theory, etc.
I learned the foundations of oil painting and thought deeply about how to assess painting.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
The strengths are: Matt and Kate are wonderful instructors who are very patient and helpful when explaining tasks and techniques. They are very good at guiding people to their strengths and making painters more confident. They also give helpful feedback. Also, the classroom atmosphere was very welcoming and encouraging.
Weakness: Perhaps the class could be even better if it were in person.

This course was great because it gave students time to get comfortable with oil paint. The projects were great because there was a lot of variety. The course was challenging to complete from my dorm room because oil paint smells and is messy. Additionally, I would be interested in a painting course that explored watercolor and acrylic as well. Having only oil as the medium did allow a lot of time to practice with it, which is great.
Amazing class! So much fun and a great break from my other courses.

This course is difficult to teach over zoom, but I thought considering that it was very successful. I am grateful for the long time allotted for the final project and the feedback Matt  provided throughout the course. The one suggestion I have would be to start with the still life project as a monochrome and then do the collage assignment.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Oil painting in the dorm was a challenge.
Any painting class would be hard to translate on Zoom. Obviously it would have been way better to take this course in a studio, but I thought Matt and Kate did an excellent job within those confines.

I think it is absurd that we were not granted studio space for this course. Painting in my small room in Trumbull was very difficult and I had to have the window opened due to the toxic fumes of oil painting. I am not sure why science students were granted access to labs but art students did not have access to any studio space or resources such as easels or basin sinks.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Absolutely would recommend - wonderful senior spring course!
Yes!!! It is a great way to get started in painting. Although the focus may not be on classic painting techniques or color theory, this class makes you paint and become a better artist!
Yes because it is a great opportunity to explore oil paint and develop painting skills.

YES! I would definitely recommend this course. I took this course as a senior and I'd never taken an art class at Yale. Matt and Kate made all of us non-art-majors feel super comfortable from the get-go, and I was shocked by how much my painting skills improved over time. I also didn't realize how important it would be for me to have a creative outlet every week, and I wish I'd taken it sooner!

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
